page.title: 02Gravenhurst- an introduction
page.content: Gravenhurst is situated at the centre of a triangle created by Hitchin, Bedford and Luton. It consists of two small groups of council houses and privately owned houses and bungalows, housing approx. 500 people. Most of the houses are new, built in the last thirty years but a few are quite old. "Chestnut Tree House" was built in l547 and Carts Farm is Elizabethan. Parts of the Post Office are l7c timber frames with wattle and daub infilling. Gravenhurst has a public house , Methodist Chapel and two Churches. St Giles is l2c and in the original Domesday Book and St Mary's which is l3c. St Mary's is a redundant church although weddings and baptisms can be held with permission from the Bishop.
